Aurochs.name: Aurochs
Aurochs.publicNotes:
This massive bovine looks like a larger, wilder version of the domesticated cattle found throughout the Inner Sea region. During winter, vast herds of the animals roam the southern reaches of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, but as the ice high in the mountains begins to melt, the aurochs migrate south into Belkzen, following their ancestral route along the Flood Road. Once the water flows in earnest and turns to massive floods, the sudden surge of greenery provides the aurochs with all the food they need to survive.

Aurochs are essential to life in Belkzen. Not only do the orcs there hunt the wild cattle for their meat, but they use every part of the aurochs, from hide to bones, to craft their weapons and tools. The aurochs' arrival prompts the beginning of the Flood Truce, during which the usually war-focused orc holds cease all hostilities to take advantage of this time of plenty.

While groups of 20 or fewer animals are sometimes encountered, most aurochs travel in herds that stretch to the horizon. The land thunders under the weight of these herds, and the dust kicked up by their hooves is often spotted days before the aurochs — or the floodwaters that spurred their migration — arrive.

Aurochs bulls stand between 6 and 7 feet tall at the shoulder and weigh around 2,500 pounds, although prodigious specimens can grow to over 7 feet tall and 3,000 pounds. Cows are smaller, standing near 6 feet at the shoulder and weighing up to 2,000 pounds. All aurochs have slightly curved horns that grow up to three feet long from base to spear-sharp tip.

The aurochs is represented in much of Belkzen's artwork. Not only are the animals vital to survival in that unforgiving land, but their strength, power, and tenacity serve as potent symbols for orc holds.

Aurochs Rolling

Farmers throughout the Inner Sea often joke about cow tipping: sneaking up on an unsuspecting bovine and pushing it over while it sleeps. But since cattle sleep lying down, the animal usually has the last laugh. Nonetheless, some younger orcs in Belkzen spend evenings creeping up on sleeping aurochs to roll them over. This usually results in little more than a startled aurochs.

action->Easily Spooked.name: Easily Spooked
action->Easily Spooked.description: The aurochs gains a +5-foot-status bonus to Speed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony}.

action->Safety in Numbers.name: Safety in Numbers
action->Safety in Numbers.description: Aurochs move together to keep safe from predators. While within 10 feet of another aurochs, the aurochs gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC.

action->Wild Charge.name: Wild Charge
action->Wild Charge.description: The aurochs Strides twice and makes a single horn Strike against any foe along its path.

Aurochs Herd.name: Aurochs Herd
Aurochs Herd.publicNotes:
Massive aurochs herds roam the badlands of Belkzen, grazing upon the limited grass and plant life dispersed throughout the wasteland's valleys. Having adapted to the arid mountain terrain, aurochs herds eat a much more diverse diet of scrub and brush than their domesticated counterparts as they steadily migrate down the Flood Road. The herds show little patience for predators and demonstrate a preference for charging threats with their razor-sharp horns. Bull aurochs display natural instincts to strategically protect other, weaker members of the herd, often surprising intruders with their coordinated tactics and defensive maneuvers.

Unlikely War Beasts

Followers of Zagresh have a history of capturing wild aurochs for use in magical experiments, taking the strongest of a herd to make the beasts even larger and more aggressive. Once the aurochs have been transformed into monstrous goliaths, their captors bard them with armored plates and magical weapons that complement their horns. In battle, these aurochs are utilized to pull siege weapons, break through enemy defenses, and trample frontline forces.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure and the creature is filled with feelings of abandonment and betrayal. When the creature rolls against the haunt's routine, they must roll twice and take the worse result. This is a misfortune effect.

On a success, the gaoler can also make a sap Strike against the target. Both attacks count toward his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

action->Punish Prisoners.name: Punish Prisoners
action->Punish Prisoners.description: The Blisterwell gaoler can quickly subdue underequipped foes, dealing an additional 1k6 precision damage with all Strikes against creatures that aren't wielding a weapon or shield. This damage applies to creatures even if they are using exceptional unarmed combat options, such as jaws, claws, or special Strikes granted by a stance.

Blisterwell Oathrisen.name: Blisterwell Oathrisen
Blisterwell Oathrisen.publicNotes:
Most undead are reanimated without consent, but those known as oathrisen arise willingly — at least at first. These loyal subordinates swear themselves to a cause or leader, vowing to assist even in death. Within days of their death, their oath reanimates them and restores most of their memories. In theory, an oathrisen's existence lasts no more than a year. In practice, the cause's leader might demand their service indefinitely. If denied their afterlife too long, some oathrisen turn on their former masters, afterward either becoming independent or destroying themselves.

The oathrisen presented here is a variant that frequents Blisterwell during the events of this Adventure Path. Other regions and traditions might create oathrisen with different abilities.

Knight By Another Name

An oathrisen resembles a graveknight — both being heavily armored, corporeal, undead warriors. Yet a graveknight arises through its own unholy ambitions and is inextricably bound to its armor. By comparison, an oathrisen reanimates out of loyalty and is not intrinsically malicious. Some oathrisen even resent graveknights, taking special joy in destroying these unholy copycats.

action->Armored Disguise.name: Armored Disguise
action->Armored Disguise.description: A Blisterwell oathrisen's undead nature is not obvious. While wearing armor, an oathrisen gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its Deception checks to Impersonate a living orc and does not require a disguise kit to do so. Creatures that don't notice the disguise are not subject to the oathrisen's Frightful Presence. An oathrisen can abandon its disguise as a free action with the manipulate trait when it attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a creature.

action->Drop the Mask.name: Drop the Mask
action->Drop the Mask.description: Once a Blisterwell oathrisen is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, portions of its armor break off. This reduces its AC by 2, increases its Speed by 5 feet, and gives it weakness 5 to vitality damage. This also immediately exposes nearby creatures to the oathrisen's frightful presence.

Bristle Boar.name: Bristle Boar
Bristle Boar.publicNotes:
The wild animals that have adapted to the harsh environs of Belkzen are either fierce enough to scare off predators, tough enough to survive attacks, or smart enough to avoid trouble. Bristle boars are all three. Many orcs admire the bristle boar, viewing them as living symbols of the toughness Belkzen demands from its inhabitants. With their spiny manes, sharp tusks, keen noses, and irascible nature, the creatures are both intimidating and dangerous.

Hunters throughout the Inner Sea region know that taking down a wild boar can prove deadly for the unprepared. Bristle boars — the name given to both male and female specimen — are even more challenging to kill. Further, their meat is sinewy, so few hunters even bother with the animals. For those who fell the beasts, the boars' spined hides often serve as trophies of the hunter's skill.

Bristle boars are not as reliant on the Deluge as other animals in Belkzen. Though they're certainly found in the green areas that spring up during the annual flooding, sounders of bristle boars can survive even in desolate areas like the Dirt Sea, grubbing for sustenance where few others can. The Cleft Head Hold maintains a small herd of tamed bristle boars.

The orcs have learned that, with the right trainer, the clever animals make excellent companions. Aside from their utility in battle, the boars are often used to sniff out the rare yellow truffles that grow throughout the hold.

A typical bristle boar stands 4 feet tall and weighs roughly 200 pounds.

Stuck Treasure

Although they don't seek out shiny objects like some animals, bristle boars who evade hunters often escape with weapons embedded in their thick hides. The Empty Hand orcs tell of a famous bristle boar dubbed "Silverspear" after the silvery spear stuck in its hide. Stories claim the boar's spear is imbued with powerful magic, and while many warriors have hunted Silverspear to claim its weapon, so far none have succeeded.

action->Bristle Spines.name: Bristle Spines
action->Bristle Spines.description: When an adjacent creature hits the bristle boar with a melee attack, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage unless it succeeds at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save.

action->Boar Charge.name: Boar Charge
action->Boar Charge.description: The bristle boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

action->Dustup.name: Dustup
action->Dustup.description:
Wymagania The bristle boar is standing in an area with soil, dust, sand, or similar debris

Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The bristle boar spins and kicks up dirt, knocking it into foes' faces. Each adjacent creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Sukces The creature is unaffected and immune to the bristle boar's Dustup for 24 hours.

Sukces The creature unaffected.

Porażka The creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} and dazzled for 1 round.

action->Destructive Vengeance.name: Destructive Vengeance
action->Destructive Vengeance.description:
Aktywator The champion of Zagresh is injured by an enemy within 15 feet

Efekt The champion of Zagresh increases the amount of damage he takes by @Damage[2d6[untyped]] and deals @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to the triggering enemy. In addition, the champion deals 2 extra void damage with their Strikes against the triggering creature until the end of his next turn.

action->Fit of Rage.name: Fit of Rage
action->Fit of Rage.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The champion swings his greatclub in a wide circle, making a melee Strike against all creatures within reach. On a critical hit, enemies are moved back 5 feet. This is forced movement. Each Strike counts toward the champion's multiple attack penalty, but his penalty doesn't increase until he's made all of his attacks.

action->Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
action->Intimidating Strike.description: The champion of Zagresh makes a melee Strike. If they hit and deal damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} on a critical hit.

action->Blessing of the Land.name: Blessing of the Land
action->Blessing of the Land.description: As long as she's within the boundaries of the Shadefields, Diskah treats all terrain as one difficulty less, for example difficult terrain has no effect, and she treats greater difficult terrain as difficult terrain.

action->Ancestral Fury.name: Ancestral Fury
action->Ancestral Fury.description: Diskah cries out in grief and rage. All creatures within a 30-foot radius must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save or have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} condition for 1 round. Diskah can't use Ancestral Fury again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ancestral Fury]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Lunar Blaze.name: Lunar Blaze
action->Lunar Blaze.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Diskah calls out to the moon and is wreathed in fiery white moonlight for 1 minute. While this ability is active, Diskah is immune to fire damage and her melee Strikes deal an additional 1k6 persistent fire damage. Any creature that hits her with a melee attack or otherwise touches her takes @Damage[1d8[fire]] damage.

action->Spirit's Blessing.name: Spirit's Blessing
action->Spirit's Blessing.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Diskah loosens one of the plaits in her braid and regains one 4th-rank spell slot she can use to cast any of her prepared 4th-rank spells.

Fattened War Pig.name: Fattened War Pig
Fattened War Pig.publicNotes:
While not native to Belkzen, these swine instead descended from livestock raided and re-homed millennia ago during orc raids. Generations of selective breeding favored larger animals suited to Belkzen's harsh environment and fearsome predators, resulting in the modern war pig. During the flood season, these pigs gorge and grow fat, gradually consuming their reserves to become leaner and meaner during the rest of the year.

Arguably domesticated, war pigs rarely remain in captivity for more than a few generations. Most orcs loathe the notion of their swine becoming too tame, instead releasing part of their herd every year to grow fierce before recapturing them seasons later. The downside is that these feral swine associate humanoids with food. Rogue war pigs sometimes form roving gangs that uproot fields, run amok, and even knock over trade caravans to eat rations (and the occasional merchant).

The "war" in war pigs comes from their use as mounts. With the right motivation, a war pig is a porcine juggernaut able to carry a fully armored orc into combat. Without discipline, care, and treats, that same pig can become 600 pounds of willful chaos that's as likely to trample foes as it is to flee combat, find a mud puddle, and crush its rider after flopping down to vigorously wallow.

action->Squealed Outrage.name: Squealed Outrage
action->Squealed Outrage.description:
Aktywator The war pig is damaged by an adjacent creature

Efekt The war pig makes a hoof Strike at the triggering creature.

action->Bulldoze.name: Bulldoze
action->Bulldoze.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The war pig Shoves an adjacent creature, after which it can either Stride or Step.

action->Fattened War Pig.name: Fattened War Pig
action->Fattened War Pig.description: The war pig gains a +2 status bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} creatures.

action->Wallow.name: Wallow
action->Wallow.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The war pig rapidly rolls over. If it has a rider, the war pig @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.nZMQh4AaBr291TUf]{Bucks} as a free action. The war pig gains 1k8 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute and can then attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of persistent acid, fire, or mental damage. If the war pig Wallows in an area with ample mud, water, loose soil, or similar material, the war pig instead gains 2k8 temporary Hit Points, for 1 minute and reduces the flat check DC to recover from persistent damage by 1.

Flood Ghoul.name: Flood Ghoul
Flood Ghoul.publicNotes:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Wymagania The flood ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Efekt The flood ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Death Echo.name: Death Echo
action->Death Echo.description:
Wymagania The flood ghoul has damaged a creature with a melee attack

Efekt The flood ghoul unleashes a wave of memories of its death by drowning. The targeted creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany} for 1 round as they relive the flood ghoul's dying moments. A creature who successfully saves becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

action->Forbidden Cravings.name: Forbidden Cravings
action->Forbidden Cravings.description:
Rzut Obronny @Check[will|dc:18]

Stadium 1 Bezobjawowy nosiciels (1 dzień)

Stadium 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 dzień)

Stadium 3 as stage 2

Stadium 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours; then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} until it consumes raw meat

Stadium 5 If the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul; if not, it returns to stage 4 .

action->Ghoul Whispers.name: Ghoul Whispers
action->Ghoul Whispers.description:
Wymagania A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Efekt The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must attempt a save against the forbidden cravings curse.

action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Floodslain Mage.name: Floodslain Mage
Floodslain Mage.publicNotes:
The sudden, crashing waters of the Deluge kill many creatures in Belkzen each year. The surprise and terror these victims of the Deluge feel during their last moments is sometimes enough to raise them from the dead as floodslain. As the waters that killed them recede, the undead seek others to join them. Despite their broken, shattered bodies, floodslain are often recognizable to those who knew them in life.

Floodslain creatures are rare outside Belkzen, leading some scholars to speculate that the waters of the Deluge are somehow cursed. Others believe the proximity of Gallowspire could be the cause. If so, this means the Gravelands could soon see floodslain arise there too, as the Whispering Tyrant furthers his plots after escaping that prison.

Panicked Eyes

One distinctive feature all floodslain share are their wide, panic-stricken eyes. A floodslain's gaze is permanently frozen in the expression of terror the creature felt moments before its death. Some floodslain are rumored to have the ability to spread this fear to others with a mere glance.

In Search of Water

Floodslain tend to move toward lower ground, instinctively seeking water. Belkzen's flat floodplains, however, mean that the creatures wander in unpredictable ways. A common saying among old orc crafters is "build on high, keep dry," but many add "build low, the dead flow."

action->Drowning Touch.name: Drowning Touch
action->Drowning Touch.description:
The target's lungs begin to fill with water, and they must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save. A target affected by Drowning Touch can spend a single action coughing in an attempt to recover, which immediately lets them attempt a new Fortitude save against the effect. A success improves the previous result by 1 step. A critical success improves the previous result by 2, and a critical failure decreases it by 1.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 round.

Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 2} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is slowed 2 and drowning.

action->Floodslain Spawn.name: Floodslain Spawn
action->Floodslain Spawn.description: A living animal or humanoid killed by a floodslain creature will rise as a floodslain if their corpse is left in water for 24 hours. The new floodslain isn't under the control of the floodslain creature that killed it.

action->Sodden Ground.name: Sodden Ground
action->Sodden Ground.description: 20 feet. Water flows endlessly from a floodslain creature, making the area around it slippery. The ground in the aura is difficult terrain for all non-floodslain creatures.

action->Vomit Flotsam.name: Vomit Flotsam
action->Vomit Flotsam.description: The floodslain vomits flotsam in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Any creature in the area takes @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).

Floodslain Orc.name: Floodslain Orc
Floodslain Orc.publicNotes:
Countless orcs have fallen victim to the Deluge over the years. Some were caught unawares by the sudden flooding, while others lost their lives trying to save loved ones, valuable goods, livestock, or their property. A few were even thrown into the raging waters during conflicts with other orcs.

Floodslain creatures are rare outside Belkzen, leading some scholars to speculate that the waters of the Deluge are somehow cursed. Others believe the proximity of Gallowspire could be the cause. If so, this means the Gravelands could soon see floodslain arise there too, as the Whispering Tyrant furthers his plots after escaping that prison.

weapon->Orc Knuckle Dagger.name: Orc Knuckle Dagger
weapon->Orc Knuckle Dagger.description: This stout, metal blade of orc design has a horizontal basket hilt with blades jutting from each end, or sometimes one blade like that of a katar.

armor->Shoddy Breastplate.name: Shoddy Breastplate
armor->Shoddy Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.pRoikbRo5HFW6YUB]{Half Plate} armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

action->Drowning Touch.name: Drowning Touch
action->Drowning Touch.description:
When the floodslain creature damages a creature with a non-weapon melee attack, the target's lungs begin to fill with water. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|against:will] save against the floodslain's Will DC. A target affected by Drowning Touch can spend a single action coughing in an attempt to recover, which immediately lets them attempt a new Fortitude save against the effect. A success improves the previous result by 1 step. A critical success improves the previous result by 2, and a critical failure decreases it by 1.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 round.

Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 2} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is slowed 2 and drowning.

Any creature in the area takes @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|against:fortitude|basic] save against the floodslain's Fortitude DC.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The floodslain wolf's Strikes deal 1k4 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the floodslain wolf's allies.

action->Opportunistic Strike.name: Opportunistic Strike
action->Opportunistic Strike.description:
Aktywator A creature within the hold sergeant's melee reach is hit by a melee attack by one of the hold sergeant's allies

Efekt The hold sergeant makes a Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Bark Orders.name: Bark Orders
action->Bark Orders.description:
Bellowing mightily, the hold sergeant gives themself and all orc allies within 60 feet a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the hold sergeant's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.PvOaRjOnUrPkfbxe]{Efekt: Bark Orders (Hold Sergeant)}

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Orc Skewermaul.name: Orc Skewermaul
weapon->Orc Skewermaul.description: As dwarves poured out of the Darklands following their Quest for Sky, the orcs driven before them adapted to their tactics — including dwarves' heavily armored infantry charges. Surviving orcs developed a response: a weapon that combines a spear and maul to crush heavy armor and skewer charging foes. Although rarely seen today, the weapon is remarkably effective in the right situation.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Back Pedal.name: Back Pedal
action->Back Pedal.description:
Aktywator K'zaard is targeted by a Strike

Efekt K'zaard moves unpredictably and suddenly as he tries to dodge. He gains a +1 circumstance bonus against the triggering attack. After the attack is resolved, K'zaard can Step.

action->Keep Talking.name: Keep Talking
action->Keep Talking.description: K'zaard continues to speak quickly and convincingly. Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony} by K'zaard's Weaseling Words can't reduce the frightened condition caused by that effect at the end of their next turn.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: K'zaard deals 2k6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} creatures.

action->Weaseling Words.name: Weaseling Words
action->Weaseling Words.description:
K'zaard weaves together a short speech that gives the listener pause. Enemies within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. While a creature is frightened by this ability, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} to K'zaard.

Krytyczny Sukces No effect, and the creature is temporarily immune to Weaseling Words for 1 minute.

Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Porażka The creature is uncertain and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is riddled with self-doubt about its own actions. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} and can't take hostile actions against K'zaard until the frightened condition ends.

weapon->Hatchet.name: Hatchet
weapon->Hatchet.description: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

armor->Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
armor->Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

action->Biggest Fan!.name: Biggest Fan!
action->Biggest Fan!.description:
Aktywator An ally Kar can see critically succeeds at a skill check or attack roll

Efekt Kar cheers exuberantly, showering the triggering ally with fawning praise. The triggering ally gains 1k6 temporary Hit Points that last 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GGxPoUu7tcASRY0G]{Efekt: Biggest Fan!}

action->My Turn!.name: My Turn!
action->My Turn!.description:
Wymagania Kar used Biggest Fan within the last minute

Efekt Eager to show she's just as strong as her ally, Kar gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks until the beginning of her next turn, but only if she performs some activity similar to the action that triggered her Biggest Fan! ability.

Magical Forge.name: Magical Forge
Magical Forge.publicNotes:
This huge forge or oven is animated to protect a workspace or kitchen, travel alongside its owner, or both.

Many animated objects have useful functions but become dangers when uncontrolled.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: Like normal objects, an animated furnace has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the furnace takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated furnace is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 24.

action->Fan the Flames.name: Fan the Flames
action->Fan the Flames.description: The animated furnace opens its door and fans its flames in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|traits:fire] save).

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Large, @Damage[(2d8+9)[fire]], Rupture 15

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Independent Brains.name: Independent Brains
action->Independent Brains.description: Each of Marguk's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can Delay. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of Marguk's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever one of the heads (such as the vorpal weapon property) doesn't cause Marguk to die if she still has her other head, but it does cause her to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of Marguk's heads.

action->Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.lR9R5Vld8Eu2Dha5]
Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Electricity or Fire)

action->Head Regrowth.name: Head Regrowth
action->Head Regrowth.description: Marguk's regeneration can regrow a severed head. After regaining Hit Points from regeneration, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:10]. On a success, the missing head is fully restored. If Marguk loses her last remaining head, she dies immediately.

action->Partial Armor.name: Partial Armor
action->Partial Armor.description: Marguk's armor primarily protects her abdomen and legs, leaving her shoulders and head exposed. Strikes made with ranged or reach weapons gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against Marguk. At the GM's discretion, other attacks that can easily reach her head level (such as attacks made from high ground) also gain this bonus.

action->Sweeping Hammer.name: Sweeping Hammer
action->Sweeping Hammer.description:
Wymagania Marguk is wielding a warhammer

Efekt Marguk makes a warhammer Strike against each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15].

action->Tenderized Feast.name: Tenderized Feast
action->Tenderized Feast.description:
Aktywator Marguk successfully Strikes a creature with her warhammer

Efekt One of Marguk's heads takes advantage of the disoriented foe and makes a jaws Strike against that creature with a –2 penalty.

Moonstalker.name: Moonstalker
Moonstalker.publicNotes:
The most tenacious hunters of the Lyrune-Quah track and kill nocturnal beasts under the light of the moon. When such a warrior perishes during the hunt, sometimes their spirit lingers and transforms into a specter of the night, refusing to move on until their prey is slain.

Loyal in Death

Though moonstalkers retain few memories of life, their connections to their quah resonate with them even after their demise. Moonstalkers have been seen protecting living Shoanti warriors who make camp within their hunting grounds, especially warbands that show reverence for the hunt. Outsiders are rarely, if ever, extended the same courtesy.

action->Site Bound.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]
Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

The moonstalker can stray no more than 120 feet from the hunting grounds where it was slain.

action->Cover of Night.name: Cover of Night
action->Cover of Night.description: A moonstalker in an area illuminated by moonlight gains a +2 status bonus to AC and Stealth checks. In the light of a full moon, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty}.

action->Lunar Shift.name: Lunar Shift
action->Lunar Shift.description:
Aktywator The moonstalker is hit by a Strike

Wymagania The moonstalker is in an area illuminated by moonlight

Efekt The moonstalker teleports through a beam of moonlight to another moonlit space within 120 feet. This does not trigger reactions.

action->Rejuvenation.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]
Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Slaying the moonstalker's prey from their final hunt allows them to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2k4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Corrupting Gaze.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR]
Corrupting Gaze
action->Corrupting Gaze.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR]

The moonstalker stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 minute.

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description: The moonstalker designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The moonstalker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the moonstalker hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1k8 precision damage. The moonstalker also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the moonstalker uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Soul Pierce.name: Soul Pierce
action->Soul Pierce.description: The moonstalker infuses soul-rending energy into a spectral arrow, making a ghostly composite longbow Strike with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:100].

weapon->Spear.name: Spear
weapon->Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
action->Intimidating Strike.description: Murshek makes a melee Strike. If she hits and deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} on a critical hit.

action->Toxic Teamwork.name: Toxic Teamwork
action->Toxic Teamwork.description: Murshek's attacks exacerbate any venom in her target's system. Against a creature affected by wyvern venom, her Strikes deal additional poison damage equal to twice the current stage of the wyvern venom affecting the target.

action->Wingrider Trust.name: Wingrider Trust
action->Wingrider Trust.description: Murshek and Xithnik operate as a team and verbally coordinate their actions. Xithnik has 3 actions, and Murshek does not need to spend any actions to command him.

Occult Weather.name: Occult Weather
Occult Weather.description: The sky suddenly darkens with storm clouds rumbling overhead, the faces of the dead forming in the clouds above as their voices wail along the high winds.
Occult Weather.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) to funnel the magic powering the weather back into itself, or @Check[religion|dc:30] (expert) to exorcise some of the trapped souls and weaken the storm; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt
Occult Weather.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the Shadefields but resets immediately. The occult weather resets 1 day after being disabled if the ancestor storm isn't put to rest.
Occult Weather.routine: (4 actions) The occult weather intensifies, with winds picking up speed and lightning and thunder sounding overhead. The occult weather uses 3 actions to make lightning Strikes against three random creatures, favoring orcs or anyone who attempted to Disable it within the past round, then uses Wind of Screams as its final action.

action->Thunder of Cries.name: Thunder of Cries
action->Thunder of Cries.description:
Aktywator A creature enters the haunt's area

Efekt The clouds darken and thunder roars, filled with the wails and screams of those killed in these lands. The shrieks of the spirits deal @Damage[(3d6+13)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Wind of Screams.name: Wind of Screams
action->Wind of Screams.description: The occult weather intensifies the wind blowing around the area, buffeting all creatures within a @Template[type:line|distance:60]. Each creature in the line must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}, taking @Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Insulting Lesson.name: Insulting Lesson
action->Insulting Lesson.description:
Aktywator A creature within 30 feet of Old Marrow critically fails at a skill check or attack roll

Efekt Old Marrow quips with mocking advice. He Feints the triggering creature, even if the creature is not within Old Marrow's melee reach.

action->Lone Wolf.name: Lone Wolf
action->Lone Wolf.description: Old Marrow works alone and excels when attacking isolated prey. His Strikes against creatures who are not adjacent to any of their allies deal 1k6 additional precision damage.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Medium, @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 30

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

One Eye Phantom.name: One Eye Phantom
One Eye Phantom.publicNotes: When the One Eye Hold betrayed Diskah Night Watcher, the dying shaman's anguish rippled out and bound the spirits of the traitors to the Ethereal Plane.

action->Walk the Ethereal Line.name: Walk the Ethereal Line
action->Walk the Ethereal Line.description: The One Eye phantom walks the thin line between the Ethereal Plane and the Universe in order to exist on both planes simultaneously. They can shift back to solely on the Ethereal Plane by using this ability again.

action->Atonement for the Damned.name: Atonement for the Damned
action->Atonement for the Damned.description: PCs might try to calm the phantoms instead of destroying them. At the GM's discretion, the PCs may attempt skill checks to talk down the spirits. On a success, the phantom's AC lowers by 2 as they become more willing to move on from their shame and dishonor, and they might even waver in attacking the PCs. Spells or rituals like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} that require penitent creatures have no effect on these phantoms.

action->Ectoplasmic Bleed.name: Ectoplasmic Bleed
action->Ectoplasmic Bleed.description: If a creature hits the phantom with a melee Strike, the creature is splashed with ectoplasm, taking @Damage[(2d4+7)[spirit]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}.

action->Susceptible to Death.name: Susceptible to Death
action->Susceptible to Death.description: Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they undead, and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death. A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a death effect (such as from a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute}) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to afterlife.

action->Phantom Touch.name: Phantom Touch
action->Phantom Touch.description: Each time they make a Strike, the One Eye phantom can choose to deal spirit damage instead of the normal physical damage type.

action->Skullcracker.name: Skullcracker
action->Skullcracker.description:
The One Eye phantom grabs the head of a creature as a jagged, spectral stone seeped with blood manifests before it. The One Eye phantom smashes the head of the creature against the stone with supernatural force, dealing @Damage[(2d12+7)[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:19] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature hallucinates that their skull has been fractured. They take full damage and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2}.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but double damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}.

action->Curse of the Destroyer's Bloodlu.name: Curse of the Destroyer's Bloodlust
action->Curse of the Destroyer's Bloodlu.description: After a turn where the oracle of Zagresh doesn't make a Strike, she takes a –2 status penalty to her AC and saving throws until she makes another Strike. During this penalty, she gains a +2 status bonus to her Strikes and fast healing 5.

action->Destructive Touch.name: Destructive Touch
action->Destructive Touch.description:
Wymagania Zagresh's Gaze is active

Efekt The oracle's hands and tusks ooze acid, making a soft sizzling noise and dealing an additional 1k6 acid damage to her unarmed attacks.

action->Zagresh's Gaze.name: Zagresh's Gaze
action->Zagresh's Gaze.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The oracle of Zagresh throws aside her weapons and focuses on the pure divine power of destruction. She attempts a @Check[will|dc:27] save. On a success, she gains access to her claw and jaws Strikes. This effect lasts [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1k4 rounds}.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
armor->Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

Orc Doomsayer.name: Orc Doomsayer
Orc Doomsayer.publicNotes:
Driven by fervor bordering on zealotry, doomsayers spread the word of their destructive deities. Many are faithful followers of recently fallen gods. Though their deity has been cast down, an orc doomsayer's unwavering faith allows them to hold onto a sliver of their god's essence to power their abilities.

The orcs of Belkzen are survivors to the core. Shaped by the unforgiving landscape, they're experts at managing resources and making do with scarcity. Aside from the relative peace from late spring through early summer during the Flood Truce, Belkzen's orc holds are nearly always at odds with each other, though these conflicts rarely rise to the level of war. Instead, there are raids for supplies, skirmishes to establish borders or retake lost territory, and feuds over personal slights. Outsiders who travel in Belkzen often become embroiled in these conflicts; sometimes they even trigger the fights themselves.

The members of a given hold are often quite spread out, rather than centralized, so communication and coordination is sporadic. Even the Empty Hand orcs of Urgir rarely stay in the city all year long. At the very least, they travel a few miles to the Flood Road when the aurochs arrive, and they may wander even further afield when the mood strikes.

Orc Faith

With so many sudden disruptions to the orc pantheon, the faithful find themselves in a confusing time of change. Fervent worshippers of Lanishra, Sezelrian, and Zagresh don't particularly like the new deities who have usurped their old gods. Some of these zealots desperately cling to their old faiths, and many still hold a sliver of their fallen deity's power, further adding to the confusion.

Salvage

Orcs are experts at repurposing materials for their own use. Belkzen doesn't have rich soil or abundant deposits of valuable metals and minerals. Instead, orc crafters rely on salvage from battles or trade with outsiders for their raw materials. It's common for a basic tool, such as a knife or cooking pot, to be very old yet kept in perfect working condition. Even when a tool breaks, orc crafters find ways to reuse as much of it as they can manage.

weapon->Flail.name: Flail
weapon->Flail.description: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.pRoikbRo5HFW6YUB]{Half Plate} armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

action->Dooming Proclamation.name: Dooming Proclamation
action->Dooming Proclamation.description:
The orc doomsayer shouts pronouncements that presage the unstoppable approach of a cataclysmic event. Each enemy within 30 feet attempts a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Krytyczny Sukces No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature's mind fills with images of the end times. The creature takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2}.

action->Infused Strikes.name: Infused Strikes
action->Infused Strikes.description: The orc doomsayer's melee Strikes deal an extra 1k8 void damage.

Orc Rampager.name: Orc Rampager
Orc Rampager.publicNotes:
Fueled by bloodlust in battle, orc rampagers are fearsome combatants. They often serve as the elite shock troops of an orc hold. They train to move quickly through enemy ranks, striking all around them to disrupt their foe's defenses. The speed and fury of a group of orc rampagers working together is terrifying to behold.

Even when a tool breaks, orc crafters find ways to reuse as much of it as they can manage.

weapon->Orc Necksplitter.name: Orc Necksplitter
weapon->Orc Necksplitter.description: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that's perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

weapon->Longbow.name: Longbow
weapon->Longbow.description: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can't be used while mounted.

armor->Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
armor->Hide Armor.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Rampaging Strikes.name: Rampaging Strikes
action->Rampaging Strikes.description: The orc rampager Strides and makes two melee Strikes at any point during that movement. Each Strike must target a different creature. The attacks count toward the rampager's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after Rampaging Strikes is complete.

Orc Vagabond.name: Orc Vagabond
Orc Vagabond.publicNotes:
Tough and no-nonsense, orc vagabonds are just as likely to serve their own interests as they are those of a warlord. Some live as bandit leaders, assembling their own group of veterans and outcasts. Many others work as the elite guards of their hold, keeping a watchful eye out for trouble.

Even when a tool breaks, orc crafters find ways to reuse as much of it as they can manage.

weapon->Battle Axe.name: Battle Axe
weapon->Battle Axe.description: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

weapon->Longbow.name: Longbow
weapon->Longbow.description: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can't be used while mounted.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Surprise Shooter.name: Surprise Shooter
action->Surprise Shooter.description: The orc vagabond's ranged attacks deal an extra 1k6 precision damage to targets adjacent to at least one of the vagabond's allies.

action->Counting Coup.name: Counting Coup
action->Counting Coup.description:
Aktywator An enemy moves within Otehika's reach

Efekt Otehika swings their weapon as close to their enemy as they can without touching them, immediately attempting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} check. On a success, the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} until the beginning of their next turn.

action->Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
action->Twin Takedown.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Wymagania Otehika wields two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Efekt Otehika makes two Strikes against their target, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same target, combine the damage from the weapons for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. They apply their multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

action->Double Shot.name: Double Shot
action->Double Shot.description: The porphyry guard makes two longbow Strikes targeting two different creatures within the longbow's first range increment. Both Strikes uses the guard's current multiple attack penalty, but each strike takes a –2 penalty.

action->Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
action->Weapon Master.description: The porphyry guard has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons they wield.

action->Shield Warden.name: Shield Warden
action->Shield Warden.description: When the shield bearer has their shield raised, they can Shield Block when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of the shield bearer.

action->Offensive Block.name: Offensive Block
action->Offensive Block.description: The shield bearer can Step, make a shield spikes Strike, and Raise their Shield in any order.

action->Retributive Bash.name: Retributive Bash
action->Retributive Bash.description: The porphyry shield bearer deals an additional 1k8 damage with weapon Strikes against any creature that has damaged the shield bearer or an adjacent ally since the beginning of the shield bearer's last turn.

action->Tenacious Shield.name: Tenacious Shield
action->Tenacious Shield.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Aktywator The shield bearer's shield would be destroyed

Efekt The shield is not destroyed and its Hit Points are instead reduced to 5.

Shadefield Spirit.name: Shadefield Spirit
Shadefield Spirit.publicNotes:
The ghost commoner is an ordinary person who believes they died unjustly.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, their souls can linger and haunt a locale significant to them in life.

action->Site Bound.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]
Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

The Shadefield spirit is bound to the Shadefields.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]
Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Putting Diskah Night Watcher's spirit to rest allows the Shadefield spirit to return to its original role as a guardian haunt.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2k4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Cindery Assault.name: Cindery Assault
action->Cindery Assault.description: The Shadefield spirit cries out in pain and anguish as flaming objects and debris fly about in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage plus @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

action->Corrupting Gaze.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR]
Corrupting Gaze
action->Corrupting Gaze.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR]

The Shadefield spirit stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:20|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 minute.

action->Sworn to the Storm.name: Sworn to the Storm
action->Sworn to the Storm.description: The Shadefield spirit gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attacks against creatures that have attempted to Disable the Shoanti ancestor storm.

Shoanti Ancestor Storm.name: Shoanti Ancestor Storm
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.description: Smoke and fire explode up around the boundaries of the storm, accusatory screams and threats of violence echoing over the winds and crackling of flames. Broken weapons and shields litter the ground and Shoanti warriors emerge from the smoke, blood running down their faces as they prepare for battle.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:26] to redirect the anger of the haunt back onto itself, @Check[intimidation|dc:28] to goad the Shadefield spirits into attacking someone outside of the ritual circle, or @Check[religion|dc:28] to assuage the spirits in the area. Four successes are needed to disable the haunt long enough for the ritual to be completed.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the Shadefields but resets immediately. The haunt is only permanently disabled when Diskah Night Watcher is put to rest. Otherwise, the haunt reforms within 24 hours of being Disabled.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.routine: (4 actions) The ancestor storm uses 1 action to release a pulse of void energy, restoring @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points to each Shadefield spirit in the area, before using its next 2 actions to make an arrows of rage Strike against all non-Shoanti creatures within 60 feet of the cairn. The haunt then uses its 4th action to use Calling the Blood on one random leader participating in the ritual. The haunt loses an action for each Shadefield spirit killed, and when there are no Shadefield spirits remaining, the haunt uses its next action to summon a new Shadefield spirit into the battle.
Shoanti Ancestor Storm.stealth: (trained) to notice the smoke intensifying and filling with the tortured faces of lost souls

action->Ancestors' Wrath.name: Ancestors' Wrath
action->Ancestors' Wrath.description:
Aktywator The ritual begins

Efekt The ancestor storm howls in fury and pain. This deals @Damage[(2d10+11)[spirit]] damage to all non-Shoanti creatures in the area, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Calling the Blood.name: Calling the Blood
action->Calling the Blood.description: The ancestor storm randomly chooses a Shoanti ritualist to distract. The ritualist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Zafascynowany} by the voices of their ancestors for 1 round, increasing the DCs to Disable the haunt by 2 for the duration.

action->Arrows of Rage.name: Arrows of Rage
action->Arrows of Rage.description: The hazard makes an arrows of rage Strike against all non-Shoanti creatures within 60 feet of the cairn.

Skeletal Drummer.name: Skeletal Drummer
Skeletal Drummer.publicNotes: To some, music is more than a hobby-it's an obsession. Every musician who lived and died for their craft runs the risk of returning as a fiddling bones, as do musicians who died before completing their magnum opus or receiving the accolades they believe they deserved. Driven to prove themselves even in undeath, fiddling bones often challenge famous performers to music duels.

equipment->Drum.name:
